$eref.description: Common properties and behavior across all Cyber Observable Objects.
$eref.title: core

___description.description: Specifies a textual description of the Object.

___extensions.description: Specifies any extensions of the object, as a dictionary.

___type.description: Indicates that this object is an Observable Object. The value of this property MUST be a valid Observable Object type name, but to allow for custom objects this has been removed from the schema.

___content_ref.description: Specifies the content of the file, represented as an Artifact Object.

___^ntfs-ext$.description: The NTFS file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to the storage of the file on the NTFS file system.

___alternate_data_streams.description: Specifies a list of NTFS alternate data streams that exist for the file.

___name.description: Specifies the name of the alternate data stream.

___hashes.description: Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the data contained in the alternate data stream.

___size.description: Specifies the size of the alternate data stream, in bytes, as a non-negative integer.

___sid.description: Specifies the security ID (SID) value assigned to the file.

___^raster-image-ext$.description: The Raster Image file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to image files.

___image_width.description: Specifies the width of the image in the image file, in pixels.

___image_compression_algorithm.description: Specifies the name of the compression algorithm used to compress the image in the image file, if applicable.

___bits_per_pixel.description: Specifies the sum of bits used for each color channel in the image in the image file, and thus the total number of pixels used for expressing the color depth of the image.

___image_height.description: Specifies the height of the image in the image file, in pixels.

___exif_tags.description: Specifies the set of EXIF tags found in the image file, as a dictionary. Each key/value pair in the dictionary represents the name/value of a single EXIF tag.

___^pdf-ext$.description: The PDF file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to PDF files.

___version.description: Specifies the decimal version number of the string from the PDF header that specifies the version of the PDF specification to which the PDF file conforms. E.g., '1.4'.

___is_optimized.description: Specifies whether the PDF file has been optimized.

patternProperties.___description: Specifies details of the PDF document information dictionary (DID), which includes properties like the document creation data and producer, as a dictionary.

pdfid1.description: Specifies the second file identifier found for the PDF file.

pdfid0.description: Specifies the first file identifier found for the PDF file.

___^archive-ext$.description: The Archive File extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to archive files.

___version.description: Specifies the version of the archive type used in the archive file.

___comment.description: Specifies a comment included as part of the archive file.

___contains_refs.description: Specifies the files contained in the archive, as a reference to one or more other File Objects. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type file-object.

___^windows-pebinary-ext$.description: The Windows PE Binary File extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to Windows portable executable (PE) files.

___characteristics_hex.description: Specifies the flags that indicate the file’s characteristics.

___number_of_sections.description: Specifies the number of sections in the PE binary, as a non-negative integer.

___size_of_optional_header.description: Specifies the size of the optional header of the PE binary.

___optional_header.description: Specifies the PE optional header of the PE binary.

___imphash.description: Specifies the special import hash, or 'imphash', calculated for the PE Binary based on its imported libraries and functions.

___pointer_to_symbol_table_hex.description: Specifies the file offset of the COFF symbol table.

___time_date_stamp.description: Specifies the time when the PE binary was created.  The timestamp value MUST BE precise to the second.

___sections.description: Specifies metadata about the sections in the PE file.

___number_of_symbols.description: Specifies the number of entries in the symbol table of the PE binary, as a non-negative integer.

___file_header_hashes.description: Specifies any hashes that were computed for the file header.

___machine_hex.description: Specifies the type of target machine.

___pe_type.description: Specifies the type of the PE binary. Open Vocabulary - windows-pebinary-type-ov

___extensions.description: The File Object defines the following extensions. In addition to these, producers MAY create their own. Extensions: ntfs-ext, raster-image-ext, pdf-ext, archive-ext, windows-pebinary-ext

$eref.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.
$eref.title: hex

___magic_number_hex.description: Specifies the hexadecimal constant ('magic number') associated with a specific file format that corresponds to the file, if applicable.

___type.description: The value of this property MUST be `file`.

$eref.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.
$eref.title: timestamp

___created.description: Specifies the date/time the file was created.

___name.description: Specifies the name of the file.

___^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

___^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-­512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA­2 family).

___^SHA3-224$.description: Specifies the SHA3-224 cryptographic hash function.

___^SHA-1$.description: Specifies the SHA­-1 (secure-­hash algorithm 1) cryptographic hash function.

___^SHA3-384$.description: Specifies the SHA3-384 cryptographic hash function.

___^MD6$.description: Specifies the MD6 message digest algorithm.

___^MD5$.description: Specifies the MD5 message digest algorithm.

___^WHIRLPOOL$.description: Specifies the whirlpool cryptographic hash function

___^SHA3-256$.description: Specifies the SHA3-256 cryptographic hash function.

___^RIPEMD-160$.description: Specifies the RIPEMD­-160 (R​ACE​ Integrity Primitives Evaluation Message Digest)​ cryptographic hash function.

___^ssdeep$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

___^SHA-256$.description: Specifies the SHA-­256 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA­2 family).

___^SHA-224$.description: Specifies the SHA-­224 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA­2 family).

___^SHA-384$.description: Specifies the SHA-­384 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA­2 family).

$eref.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs
$eref.title: dictionary

___hashes.description: Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the file.

___parent_directory_ref.description: Specifies the parent directory of the file, as a reference to a Directory Object.

$eref.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.
$eref.title: timestamp

___accessed.description: Specifies the date/time the file was last accessed.

___mime_type.description: Specifies the MIME type name specified for the file, e.g., 'application/msword'.

___name_enc.description: Specifies the observed encoding for the name of the file.

___size.description: Specifies the size of the file, in bytes, as a non-negative integer.

$eref.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.
$eref.title: timestamp

___modified.description: Specifies the date/time the file was last written to/modified.

___contains_refs.description: Specifies a list of references to other Observable Objects contained within the file.

___decryption_key.description: Specifies the decryption key used to decrypt the archive file.

___encryption_algorithm.description: Specifies the name of the encryption algorithm used to encrypt the file. Open Vocabulary - encryption-algorithm-ov

___is_encrypted.description: Specifies whether the file is encrypted.
Specifies whether the file is encrypted.

description: The File Object represents the properties of a file.
title: file

_88windows-pe-section.description: The PE Section type specifies metadata about a PE file section.

___name.description: Specifies the name of the section.

___^SHA3-512$.description: Specifies the SHA3-512 cryptographic hash function.

___^SHA-512$.description: Specifies the SHA-­512 cryptographic hash function (part of the SHA­2 family).

___^ssdeep$.description: Specifies the ssdeep fuzzy hashing algorithm.

$eref.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs
$eref.title: dictionary

___hashes.description: Specifies any hashes computed over the section.

___entropy.description: Specifies the calculated entropy for the section, as calculated using the Shannon algorithm.

___size.description: Specifies the size of the section, in bytes.

___is_encrypted.description: Specifies whether the file is encrypted.

_88windows-pe-optional-header-type.description: The Windows PE Optional Header type represents the properties of the PE optional header.

___minor_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the subsystem.

___size_of_stack_commit.description: Specifies the size of the stack to commit.

$eref.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.
$eref.title: hex

___magic_hex.description: Specifies the unsigned integer that indicates the type of the PE binary.

___size_of_initialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the initialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

$eref.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.
$eref.title: hex

$eref.description: A dictionary captures a set of key/value pairs
$eref.title: dictionary

___hashes.description: Specifies any hashes that were computed for the optional header.

___size_of_stack_reserve.description: Specifies the size of the stack to reserve

___image_base.description: Specifies the preferred address of the first byte of the image when loaded into memory.

___size_of_heap_reserve.description: Specifies the size of the local heap space to reserve.

___size_of_code.description: Specifies the size of the code (text) section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

___major_os_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the required operating system.

$eref.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.
$eref.title: hex

___checksum_hex.description: Specifies the checksum of the PE binary.

___file_alignment.description: Specifies the factor (in bytes) that is used to align the raw data of sections in the image file.

$eref.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.
$eref.title: hex

___dll_characteristics_hex.description: Specifies the flags that characterize the PE binary.

___section_alignment.description: Specifies the alignment (in bytes) of PE sections when they are loaded into memory.

___major_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker major version number.

___address_of_entry_point.description: Specifies the address of the entry point relative to the image base when the executable is loaded into memory.

___size_of_uninitialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the uninitialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

$eref.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.
$eref.title: hex

___subsystem_hex.description: Specifies the subsystem (e.g., GUI, device driver, etc.) that is required to run this image.

___minor_image_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the image.

___major_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the subsystem.

___size_of_heap_commit.description: Specifies the size of the local heap space to commit.

___size_of_headers.description: Specifies the combined size of the MS-DOS, PE header, and section headers, rounded up a multiple of the value specified in the file_alignment header.

___minor_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker minor version number.

___size_of_image.description: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the image, including all headers, as the image is loaded in memory.

___minor_os_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the required operating system.

___number_of_rva_and_sizes.description: Specifies the number of data-directory entries in the remainder of the optional header.

___base_of_data.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-data section when it is loaded into memory.

___major_image_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the image.

___base_of_code.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-code section when it is loaded into memory.

___alternate_data_streams.description: Specifies a list of NTFS alternate data streams that exist for the file.

___name.description: Specifies the name of the alternate data stream.

___hashes.description: Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the data contained in the alternate data stream.

___size.description: Specifies the size of the alternate data stream, in bytes, as a non-negative integer.

___sid.description: Specifies the security ID (SID) value assigned to the file.

___^raster-image-ext$.description: The Raster Image file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to image files.

___image_width.description: Specifies the width of the image in the image file, in pixels.

___image_compression_algorithm.description: Specifies the name of the compression algorithm used to compress the image in the image file, if applicable.

___bits_per_pixel.description: Specifies the sum of bits used for each color channel in the image in the image file, and thus the total number of pixels used for expressing the color depth of the image.

___image_height.description: Specifies the height of the image in the image file, in pixels.

___exif_tags.description: Specifies the set of EXIF tags found in the image file, as a dictionary. Each key/value pair in the dictionary represents the name/value of a single EXIF tag.

___^pdf-ext$.description: The PDF file extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to PDF files.

___version.description: Specifies the decimal version number of the string from the PDF header that specifies the version of the PDF specification to which the PDF file conforms. E.g., '1.4'.

___is_optimized.description: Specifies whether the PDF file has been optimized.

patternProperties.___description: Specifies details of the PDF document information dictionary (DID), which includes properties like the document creation data and producer, as a dictionary.

pdfid1.description: Specifies the second file identifier found for the PDF file.

pdfid0.description: Specifies the first file identifier found for the PDF file.

___^archive-ext$.description: The Archive File extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to archive files.

___version.description: Specifies the version of the archive type used in the archive file.

___comment.description: Specifies a comment included as part of the archive file.

___contains_refs.description: Specifies the files contained in the archive, as a reference to one or more other File Objects. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type file-object.

___^windows-pebinary-ext$.description: The Windows PE Binary File extension specifies a default extension for capturing properties specific to Windows portable executable (PE) files.

$eref.description: The hex data type encodes an array of octets (8-bit bytes) as hexadecimal. The string MUST consist of an even number of hexadecimal characters, which are the digits '0' through '9' and the letters 'a' through 'f'.  In order to allow pattern matching on custom objects, all properties that use the hex type, the property name MUST end with '_hex'.

___characteristics_hex.description: Specifies the flags that indicate the file’s characteristics.

___number_of_sections.description: Specifies the number of sections in the PE binary, as a non-negative integer.

___size_of_optional_header.description: Specifies the size of the optional header of the PE binary.

$eref.description: The Windows PE Optional Header type represents the properties of the PE optional header.

___minor_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the subsystem.

___size_of_stack_commit.description: Specifies the size of the stack to commit.

___magic_hex.description: Specifies the unsigned integer that indicates the type of the PE binary.

___size_of_initialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the initialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

___size_of_code.description: Specifies the size of the code (text) section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

___major_os_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the required operating system.

___checksum_hex.description: Specifies the checksum of the PE binary.

___file_alignment.description: Specifies the factor (in bytes) that is used to align the raw data of sections in the image file.

___dll_characteristics_hex.description: Specifies the flags that characterize the PE binary.

___section_alignment.description: Specifies the alignment (in bytes) of PE sections when they are loaded into memory.

___major_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker major version number.

___address_of_entry_point.description: Specifies the address of the entry point relative to the image base when the executable is loaded into memory.

___size_of_uninitialized_data.description: Specifies the size of the uninitialized data section. If there are multiple such sections, this refers to the sum of the sizes of each section.

___minor_image_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the image.

___major_subsystem_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the subsystem.

___size_of_heap_commit.description: Specifies the size of the local heap space to commit.

___size_of_headers.description: Specifies the combined size of the MS-DOS, PE header, and section headers, rounded up a multiple of the value specified in the file_alignment header.

___minor_linker_version.description: Specifies the linker minor version number.

___size_of_image.description: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the image, including all headers, as the image is loaded in memory.

___minor_os_version.description: Specifies the minor version number of the required operating system.

___number_of_rva_and_sizes.description: Specifies the number of data-directory entries in the remainder of the optional header.

___base_of_data.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-data section when it is loaded into memory.

___major_image_version.description: Specifies the major version number of the image.

___base_of_code.description: Specifies the address that is relative to the image base of the beginning-of-code section when it is loaded into memory.

___optional_header.description: Specifies the PE optional header of the PE binary.

___imphash.description: Specifies the special import hash, or 'imphash', calculated for the PE Binary based on its imported libraries and functions.
